meanings.definition: The quality or state of being muddy.
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the muddiness of the path made it hard to walk.
meanings.sent2: The muddiness of the water made it impossible to see what was beneath the surface.
meanings.sent3: The muddiness of the situation was so confusing that even the cat got lost.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a muddiness of thoughts, swirling and mixing without clarity.
meanings.sent5: The muddiness of the painting gave it a unique texture, like a rough sea frozen in time.

meanings.sent1: The muddiness of his explanation left everyone more confused than before.
meanings.sent2: The muddiness of the instructions made it hard to assemble the furniture.
meanings.sent3: Trying to find her way through the maze of muddiness in his speech was like navigating a foggy forest.
meanings.sent4: The muddiness of her memory was like trying to see through a foggy window.
meanings.sent5: The muddiness of the map led them in circles, unable to find their way out of the forest.
